lead_paragraph: LEAD: A consortium of California banks met in Los Angeles today to discuss forming a nonprofit mortgage banking corporation to finance low-cost housing in the state. The California Community Reinvestment Corporation, the lenders' group, said it would try to pool $100 million from participating banks to provide long-term loans for housing.

byline.original: Special to the New York Times
